name: AzureSpringCloud
description: Deploy applications to Azure Spring Cloud and manage deployments.
author: Microsoft Corporation

inputs.name: ConnectedServiceName
inputs.label: Azure subscription
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select the Azure Resource Manager subscription for the deployment.

inputs.name: Action
inputs.label: Action
inputs.helpMarkDown: Action to be performed on Azure Spring Cloud.

inputs.name: AzureSpringCloud
inputs.label: Azure Spring Cloud Name
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select the Azure Spring Cloud service to which to deploy.

inputs.name: AppName
inputs.label: App
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select the Azure Spring Cloud app to deploy.

inputs.name: DeploymentType
inputs.label: Deployment Type
inputs.helpMarkDown: To deploy with source code or Java package, choose "Artifacts"; To deploy with container image, choose "Custom Container"

inputs.name: UseStagingDeployment
inputs.label: Use Staging Deployment
inputs.helpMarkDown: Automatically select the deployment that's set as Staging at the time the task runs.

inputs.name: CreateNewDeployment
inputs.label: Create a new staging deployment if one does not exist.
inputs.helpMarkDown: Whether to target the deployment that's set as Staging at the time of execution. If unchecked, the 'Deployment Name' setting must be set.

inputs.name: DeploymentName
inputs.label: Deployment
inputs.visibleRule: UseStagingDeployment = false && Action != Delete Staging Deployment
inputs.helpMarkDown: The deployment to which this task will apply. Lowercase letters and numbers only; must start with a letter.

inputs.name: Package
inputs.label: Package or folder
inputs.helpMarkDown:
File path to the package or a folder containing the Spring Cloud app contents.
Variables ( [Build](https://docs.microsoft.com/vsts/pipelines/build/variables) | [Release](https://docs.microsoft.com/vsts/pipelines/release/variables#default-variables)), wildcards are supported.
For example, $(System.DefaultWorkingDirectory)/\*\*/\*.jar.

inputs.name: Builder
inputs.label: Builder
inputs.helpMarkDown:
Select a builder of VMware Tanzu® Build Service™, this can be used in enterprise tier.
For detailed description, please check [Use Tanzu Build Service](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/spring-cloud/how-to-enterprise-build-service?tabs=azure-portal).

inputs.name: RegistryServer
inputs.label: Registry Server
inputs.helpMarkDown: The registry of the container image.  Default: docker.io.

inputs.name: RegistryUsername
inputs.label: Registry Username
inputs.helpMarkDown: The username of the container registry.

inputs.name: RegistryPassword
inputs.label: Registry Password
inputs.helpMarkDown: The password of the container registry.

inputs.name: ImageName
inputs.label: Image Name and Tag
inputs.helpMarkDown: The container image tag.

inputs.name: ImageCommand
inputs.label: Image Command
inputs.helpMarkDown: The command of the container image.

inputs.name: ImageArgs
inputs.label: Image Arguments
inputs.helpMarkDown: The arguments of the container image.

inputs.name: EnvironmentVariables
inputs.label: Environment Variables
inputs.helpMarkDown: Edit the app's environment variables.

inputs.name: JvmOptions
inputs.label: JVM Options
inputs.helpMarkDown: Edit the app's JVM options. A String containing JVM Options. Example: `-Xms1024m -Xmx2048m`

inputs.name: RuntimeVersion
inputs.label: Runtime Version
inputs.helpMarkDown: The runtime on which the app will run.

inputs.name: DotNetCoreMainEntryPath
inputs.label: Main Entry Path
inputs.helpMarkDown: The path to the .NET executable relative to zip root.

outputVariables.name: testEndpoint
outputVariables.description: After the 'Deploy' action only. Contains private URL for accessing the updated deployment.

messages.ResourceDoesntExist: Resource '%s' doesn't exist. Resource should exist before deployment.
messages.UnableToGetDeploymentUrl: Unable to get deployment URL for Azure Spring Cloud '%s', Error: '%s'
messages.DeploymentDoesntExist: Deployment with name '%s' does not exist. Unable to proceed.
messages.StagingDeploymentWithNameDoesntExist: Staging deployment with name %s does not exist. Unable to proceed.
messages.TwoDeploymentsAlreadyExistCannotCreate: Deployment with name '%s' does not exist and cannot be created, as two deployments already exist.
messages.PrivateTestEndpointNotEnabled: Private test endpoint is not enabled.
messages.UnableToRetrieveTestEndpointKeys: Unable to retrieve test endpoint keys
messages.DuplicateAzureSpringCloudName: Illegal state: multiple Azure Spring Cloud instances with same name.
messages.InvalidAzureSpringCloudResourceId: Invalid azure spring cloud resource identifier: %s
messages.Nopackagefoundwithspecifiedpattern: No package found with specified pattern: %s. Check if the package mentioned in the task is published as an artifact in the build or a previous stage and downloaded in the current job.
messages.Morethanonepackagematchedwithspecifiedpa: More than one package matched with specified pattern: %s. Please restrain the search pattern.
